en: A tester suggests you hide some more complex features of your product somewhere beneath the surface of the main interface.
They feel it's overwhelming to new users, who'll likely turn the thing off rather than put in the effort to learn it all.
However, the vast majority of users don't look in the settings of an app. People will likely never see those features if you take the tester's advice. What should you do?
You decide to hide some of the more complex features. Hopefully, users who want those options will be willing to search for them.
You decide to keep it complex. You hope this will appeal more to a niche audience of pro users.
